name: amiloz
headline: Micro-lender in Mexico
description: We are a Y Combinator / Latitud backed micro-lending platform in Mexico led by talent from companies such as Capital One, Bain & Company, Konfio, DiDi, Clip, Klarna, etc. We are hyper focused on making sure that customers improve their financial lives significantly through their relationship with us. In a very short time, we have achieved significant traction with exceptional consumer outcomes and unit economics. We are also building and incorporating a significant amount of AI into our operations, so this is a great place to work for anybody who has ambitions to build real time applications of AI. Our goal is to build the biggest AI enabled consumer fintech platform in Mexico and eventually LatAm.

founders.name: Debashish Bhadra, Founder
founders.description:
Past experience: fintech, VC / IB / PE
Director / Head of Credit at Konfio, Mexico City
Sr Mgr Credit at Capital One Bank, Washington DC
Previously in venture capital (Ribbit Capital), private equity (Warburg Pincus) and investment banking (J.P. Morgan)

founders.name: Gianfranco Gentille, Founder
founders.description: Married with 1 small kid and a dog. Very diverse experience in operations, strategy, product and finance (trading and investments) at DiDi, Bain, Deloitte, BBVA and Central Bank of Peru. Strategist, project manager, entrepreneur excited about starting things out. Building the next grocery inventory procurement B2B ecommerce.

### Amiloz: Revolutionizing Micro-Lending in Mexico

**Overview**
Founded in 2021 and part of Y Combinator Batch W22, Amiloz is a micro-lending platform based in Mexico City. The company aims to dramatically improve the financial lives of its users through a modern, digital lending approach. With a dedicated team of 20 professionals from impressive backgrounds—Capital One, Bain & Company, Konfio, DiDi, and others—Amiloz has rapidly gained traction in the Mexican fintech scene.

**Mission and Vision**
Amiloz's mission is simple yet profound: empower individuals in Mexico with accessible financial solutions through innovative lending practices. Their vision extends beyond just lending; they aim to become the largest AI-enabled consumer fintech platform in Mexico and across Latin America.

**How It Works**
Amiloz offers a digital-first approach to lending:
- **Fast, secure, and interest-free loans**: Customers can customize loan amounts and payment terms with an initial offer of 0% interest.
- **User-friendly application process**: From downloading the app (yes, it's available on both Android and iOS) to receiving funds directly in your bank account, the entire experience is designed to be hassle-free. 
- **Ability to renew credit lines**: Regular payments enhance credit limits, allowing users to borrow more over time while building a financially healthy relationship with the platform.

**The Opportunity**
Amiloz isn't just another app; it's a part of a broader fintech trend aiming to increase financial inclusion in regions often underserved by traditional banks. This focus not only addresses the immediate lending needs but also aims to improve the overall financial literacy of its users.

**Technology and Innovation**
A significant aspect of Amiloz's strategy is its incorporation of AI technologies, which enhance their operations and decision-making processes. If you're interested in developing real-time AI applications, this is a place where innovation is at the core of everything they do.

**Conclusion**
In a world where financial services are increasingly dominated by technology, Amiloz is positioned to make a lasting impact, not just for consumers in Mexico but potentially throughout Latin America. The blend of talent, innovation, and user-centric design places Amiloz at the forefront of the fintech revolution.

For more information about Amiloz and to apply for a loan, visit [Amiloz](https://www.beloz.com.mx/).
